components.camera

Class CameraComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Component
      • components.camera.CameraComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Camera, IComponent, Invalidatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FreeCameraComponent

    public class CameraComponent
extends Component
implements Camera
    Implements basic camera functions. It has two projection modes: perspective and orthographic and you can switch between them anytime you want. Note that the field of view is only used in perspective mode and the scale is only used in orthographic mode. By the way you cen also get or set these values anytime. This Component offers you frustum culling methods in both modes. You can get the camera's projection and view matrices.
    See Also:
    GameObject

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface components.camera.Camera

      • CameraComponent

        public CameraComponent()
        Initializes a new CameraComponent in perspective mode.
        See Also:
        ProjectionMode

      • CameraComponent

        public CameraComponent(float fov,
                       float nearPlane,
                       float farPlane)
        Initializes a new CameraComponent to the given values. Note that the near plane's distance must be higher than 0 and lower than the far plane's distance. Fov must be higher than 0 and lower than 180.
        Parameters:
        fov - vertical field of view (in degrees)
        nearPlane - near plane's distance
        farPlane - far plane's distance

      • setFov

        public void setFov(float fov)

        Throws:

      • isInsideFrustum

        public boolean isInsideFrustum(@NotNull
                               org.joml.Vector3f position,
                               float radius)
        Returns true if the sphere (determined by the given parameters) is inside, or intersects the frustum and returns false if it is fully outside. Note that if frustum culling is disabled, or this Component isn't connected to a GameObject this method always returns true.
        Specified by:
        isInsideFrustum in interface Camera
        Parameters:
        position - position
        radius - radius
        Returns:
        false if the sphere is fully outside the frustum, true otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - position can't be null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - radius can't be negative
        See Also:
        Settings.isFrustumCulling()

      • isInsideFrustum

        public boolean isInsideFrustum(@NotNull
                               org.joml.Vector3f aabbMin,
                               @NotNull
                               org.joml.Vector3f aabbMax)
        Returns true if the axis alligned bounding box (determined by the given parameters) is inside, or intersects the frustum and returns false if it is fully outside. Note that if frustum culling is disabled, or this Component isn't connected to a GameObject this method always returns true.
        Specified by:
        isInsideFrustum in interface Camera
        Parameters:
        aabbMin - the axis alligned bounding box's minimum x, y and z values
        aabbMax - the axis alligned bounding box's maximum x, y and z values
        Returns:
        false if the bounding box is fully outside the frustum, true otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - the parameters can't be null
        See Also:
        Settings.isFrustumCulling()

      • getFrustumCornerPoints

        @Nullable
 @ReadOnly
public java.util.List<org.joml.Vector3f> getFrustumCornerPoints()
        Returns the frustum's corner points in the following order: far-top-left, far-top-right, far-bottom-left, far-bottom-right, near-top-left, near-top-right, near-bottom-left, near-bottom-right. If this Component isn't connected to a GameObject, this method returns null.
        Specified by:
        getFrustumCornerPoints in interface Camera
        Returns:
        frustum's corner points

      • createUbo

        private static void createUbo()
        Creates the UBO.

      • releaseUbo

        public static void releaseUbo()
        Releases the UBO. After calling this mathod, you can't use the Matrices UBO and can't recreate it. Note that some renderers (like the BlinnPhongRenderer) may expect to access to the Matrices UBO (which isn't possible after calling this method).
